data.title: diver infantry for both factions.
data.body:
So with the whole submarine fiasco i am hearing here and there about finding them i found a way to make everyone's live easier.

the diver would basicaly be a rocket soldier that is slower than most infantry but faster in the water,they would be invisible to infantry,vehicles and submarines underwater until they attack,they would deal minimal damage to infantry,vehicles and plane's but would do immense damage to ships and submarines(the missiles would still home at planes and heli's).The unit would be more expensive than a rocket soldier but would have a little less health than a rocket soldier,and to offset that they take more damage than soviet planes and we could tweak the gunboat to do more damage to infantry.

data.title: Make aircraft crashes less predictable.
data.body:
Planes should fly a random amount of cells and in a slightly random direction from what path they were on when they are shot down. This way you can't just predict where they will crash so easily.

Unless we want them to say kamikaze is a strategy?

data.title: Fix UpgradeRules for upgrading mods targeting release-20131223.
Fix replays for network games.
data.body: Fixes #4866.

data.title: dedicated fix: do not restart anymore with 1 client
data.body: Noticed that it does not work in latest bleed anymore (client gets "Connection dropped" dialog once server is closed), seem it relied on wrong behavior which has been fixed recently.

data.title: MainMenu is shown along with Multiplayer Menu
data.body: In all mods. Happens when I click "Abort" trying to connect to server.

data.title: Asynchronous map downloading.
data.body:
This replaces the janky and crashy map download support with a much smoother implementation:
![async](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/2444122/731fba66-ae4a-11e3-8a30-be0664e63c90.png)

Admins attempting to force start a game are now prompted with a confirmation dialog pointing out that this is a rather rude thing to do, and also that players will be kicked if anybody is missing the map:
![kick](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/2444140/e736f3a6-ae4a-11e3-9a4c-6a9761c54ab9.png)

This also uses the resource website to fill in unknown map details in the server browser (note the RA and C&C maps in the D2K chooser):
![browser](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/2444129/8f53f224-ae4a-11e3-84b0-bc5eb007c07f.png)

data.title: Add garrison support for player-owned transports
data.body:
This cleans up the Attack\* and muzzle flash code, and adds support for transports (including buildings) that let their passengers shoot through defined firing ports.

The RA pillboxes have been migrated to this new system.
Support for garrisoning civilian structures will be done in a future pr, as this will first need EffectiveOwner to be implemented uniformly through the engine.

data.title: Add port of scg04ea mission
data.body:
This is a pretty straight-forward port of scg04ea.  I tried to keep it pretty close to the original, but made it a little harder in places by adding some reinforcements that were disabled in the original and making some units less passive on normal skill.

It's still quite easy, though. You can run through it in less than a minute if you're fast, and three minutes is well over par, I'd say.

There are few minor issues with this map:
- AFAICS a crate always assumes it has a CrateAction attached. So I chose the HealUnits crate to not make the crate do anything overly obvious.
- I work around the current lack of a cell trigger with Map.FindUnitsInCircle. Performance-wise not optimal, obviously, but on such a small map not really noticeable, either.
- The mission's title is too long for the map browser.

Needs #4854 to work.

data.title: Have *.lua contribute to the map hash
data.body:
to avoid conflicts with auto map download.

data.title: remove free-coasts.oramap
MustBeDestroyed can't be negated
data.body:
I tried to solve https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4892 by adding `-MustBeDestroyed:` to `HBOX` which inherits it from `^Building`. This crashes badly when I build `HBOX.E1` which inherits `HBOX` in-game.


data.title: Pausing the game will not pause chronosphere
data.body:
Pausing the game will not pause chronosphere on RA mod.

So if i teleport my stuff, and someone pauses the game, the chrono keeps going on and when game is unpaused, the units will be teleported back after 1 sec of being teleported.

Edit: i assume this bug is for iron curtain as well?

data.title: Alt tab issues
data.body:
I have noticed alt tabbing out a few times causes F1 to be unresponsive to bring up statistics page. However, clicking the button still worked.

Also alt tabbing also causes all AI to move at an increased speed, anywhere from 25 to 33 percent for a short time in AI vs AI battles.

This is with a Windows 7 Home Premium 64 bit machine by the way.

data.title: One AI in AI vs AI/ AI & Player vs AI team battles starts lagging game after some time
data.body:
![why-so-high-openra](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6969122/2432079/f88b1380-ad50-11e3-82b2-b47b77459a73.jpg)

Replays download for bug hunting: http://www.mediafire.com/download/8nil052c27ip30d/release-20131223_possibleAIbugs.zip

Hello, after some time spectating or playing some games in RA with AI against other AIs, 1) one of the AI opponents begins to have its actions per minute slowly rising which eventually begins lagging the game and having framerate skipping and stays like this, but the skipping never gets worse. The only way at the moment was hitting escape and the APM goes down slowly but as soon as I resume it starts going up again.

Oh, and I was testing with the Hard AI by the way and using the music pack posted by ddd on Sleipnir's OpenRA forum, I doubt that would cause desync, would it?

data.title: D2k Thumper and Worms
data.body: I am not a huge fan of the random worms appearing in d2k (the serious d2k players play without worms anyway) but it would be nice to have the Thumper being able to attract worms in a certain area around the thumper. The worm should attack/eat any vehicle unit in this area. Is someone interested in adding this?

data.title: Map editor doesn't copy actors in selected area
data.body: When I select an area and use the stamp tool to duplicate that area, actors like ore mines and trees are not carried over. Maybe there should be a more straightforward copy/cut/paste selection tool. Because it is not possible to cut a selection at the moment.

data.title: Add buildable concrete to D2K.
Option for playing missions in original / new balancing.
data.body:
I feel like this would be a good idea if its not to hard to implement, since by the time we get to some of the later missions due to our balancing changes we could be modifying things a fair amount.

Not only will we be able to give mission authors greater creative freedom when redesigning the original campaigns, it will give us flexibility to add new missions, change existing missions, ad co-op missions etc. While at the same time having a "pure" campaign with the missions that use the original rules.

Interested in hearing everyone else's opinions :) 

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1440217-option-for-playing-missions-in-original-new-balancing?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.body: I tried to add the Carryall as a Buildable Transport vehicle. I am having some graphic problems though. The carryall shadow looks strange and is sometimes visible on the carryall itself. How can i fix that?

data.title: Replay browser should show players and spawn selection
Reorganize map management and preview generation
data.body:
- Map enumeration and the (previously global static) preview generation have moved into a new MapCache class that lives on ModData.
- Map previews are now batched into sheets, instead of using one texture per map.
- UI map access is now wrapped inside a MapPreview object. MapPreview supports multiple states (available, unavailable, and the next pr will introduce downloadable), and these can be updated dynamically without requiring any action by the code using them.
- Cleans up some other code in replays/server browser/map chooser that got in my way.

This gives us support for custom map previews (see screenshot), and lays most of the foundations for future resource website integration.

![preview](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/2429517/1310ea60-ac87-11e3-930b-b0ddfe194569.png)
